Naruto Shippuuden takes a nice shit on the Naruto series. Even if you take away all the filler, the core material completely eradicates the main message of the original series. Naruto was supposed to be about a child who was not gifted and he attempt to follow his impossible dream. But Shipuuden takes the typical shonen route and makes the story about a chosen boy who must save the world. This is not a good series, most characters are back seated for Naruto, and though it has its good moments, the series took a huge nose dive. The story follows the end of Naruto, andnow Naruto wants to save Sasuke and defeat the Akatsuki, while the Akatsuki look interesting at first, the story starts to unravel into a huge "this was all apart of my plan!" type theme. Where the evil genius keeps being trumped by another evil genius. Naruto's character changes for the worst, sakura looks as if she is going to become an actual decent character but that is shit on. Kakashi is decent along with shikamaru but eventually every character becomes a narutard, also known as a character that falls in love with naruto and just spouts out naruto like messages, this turns their characters into naruto clones. The villains were interesting, and they would be good if the series stopped using the whole "He was just like Naruto, except he could not be happy" type theme, it became an in series cliche. The art was eh at many moments, yet the music was good. So I was NOT look at this series, instead if you want some shonen in your life go READ one piece, as the anime has become visual garbage. also soul eater should take care of your anime fighting craving, and it is short as well.

I don't remember the exact last episode I watched, but this show is garbage and everyone should steer clear of it. I watched every episode of Naruto when they aired starting the year the show received an English dub. I stopped during the final arc of the show. I had highly enjoyed the show through much of it and I don't think I'd take those moments back. 
However, I cannot recommend this show whatsoever to anyone. The studio who made this show MILKED their FANS for money. The manga had been completed at the time the show decided to start running filler in the middleof their final arc. I have spent 7 years watching this show as a loyal fan and I stopped during the final arc. It's because the filler they started doing in the middle of the final arc lasted for over 2.5 years. I waiting 2 years to let episodes build up so my father and I could watch roughly 120 episodes together and binge it hard. There were only 3 canon episodes released within those 2.5 years and the manga had been finished that whole time, meaning the studio was purposely writing 2.5 years of filler to make money from view counts. It's absolutely disgusting. \n\n
Then to top it all off they made the damn Boruto movie before they even finished the Naruto Shippuuden anime. I am so mad and disappointed. I will never watch another anime from this garbage studio again. Save yourself the trouble and watch a different studio's show. They'll probably care more about their fans and give you an enjoyable show.

IS THIS ANIME TIME EFFICIENT ?
  NO. NOT AT ALL; BUT LET ME SAY THIS...
  I ask myself what makes these kind of animes so valuable to me. This anime is nowhere near perfect. Answer is actually pretty clear. I am a viewer who can put his time on this long series and enjoy it. So if you can relate to what I am saying, I can ensure you that this show has the most epic scenes in the world.
It all comes down to the person who watches. This anime is not for everyone. But those who finished it know howthey fucking enjoyed the boner they got when Guy and Madara fought. What I am trying to say is, this show pays off when you put your time on it. Just like other episodic series.\n

Naruto Shipppuuden has a spectacular story with well built characters. I am not only talking about the main characters, but also secondary characters and especially the villains.
Not to mention that it has the best fighting animations ever seen. Not only the animation at technical level but the own choreography and strategies of the fight according to each individual and its power.
The story has many ramifications and variants, which despite one and another plot hole (which is understandable because of the extended time of its development) every each character evolve and go through a growth and development of character.
Naruto is that character that we can understandand we want to be like him. We see his growth, it is not a character of 2 dimensions, but of 3 or 4. The same happens with many others, and the most fascinating are the villains. Especially those from Akatsuki. For me, Pain is one of the best-built villains I've seen so far in anime and even in movies.\n\n
I quoted this anime on my master's thesis countless times, exactly because of its story and character construction, and also because of its animations and fight choreography.\n\n
Anyone who loves a good fight (choreographically and visually) will feel immense satisfaction in this anime. Just like anyone who likes a good story with good heroes and good villains, both quite human. They do not make the characters just the flawless hero or the inhuman villain. No. The characters have a reason that moves them, because of their life experiences.\n\n
I strongly advise.\n
My favorite anime, no doubt.
